intro: Caladenia vulgata, commonly known as the common spider-orchid, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, spider-like flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland habitats, often in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to orange in color, with intricate patterns that mimic the appearance of spiders. Caladenia vulgata is a perennial herb that produces its flowers during the autumn season.
